hook.text: When you cut yourself, your body launches a four-stage repair mission within seconds.

buildup.text: First, blood vessels constrict to slow bleeding. Then platelets rush in and form a plug.

discovery.text: A protein mesh called fibrin weaves over the plug, creating a solid clot.

twist.text: White blood cells swarm in to kill bacteria. Inflammation is your body fighting infection.

climax.text: New skin cells grow from the edges inward, eventually replacing the clot with a scar.

punchline.text: A scab isn't a bandage. It's a battlefield where your body won the war.

quiz.question: What forms the solid structure of a blood clot?
options: A fibrin protein mesh over platelet plug
Skin cells growing rapidly at the surface
